01_data_basics/01_counting/05_read_frequency_distribution_v2

A random procedure generated 100 measurements, which were organized into the frequency distribution shown below. You can assume the measurements are of a continuous random variable, such that every measurement is in one of the intervals (and not on a break).

interval frequency
45 — 45.5 2
45.5 — 46 1
46 — 46.5 7
46.5 — 47 2
47 — 47.5 6
47.5 — 48 5
48 — 48.5 7
48.5 — 49 14
49 — 49.5 17
49.5 — 50 39

  1. Evaluate \(\#[\mathbf{x}<48.5]\).
  2. Evaluate \(\#[\mathbf{x}>47.5]\).
  3. Evaluate \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-47.25|<1.25]\).
  4. Evaluate \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-48|>1.5]\).
  5. Find boundary \(b\) such that \(\#[\mathbf{x}<b] = 23\).
  6. Find boundary \(b\) such that \(\#[\mathbf{x}>b] = 82\).
  7. Find radius \(r\) such that \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-48.25|<r] = 49\).
  8. Find radius \(r\) such that \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-49.25|>r] = 83\).
